Drill-down into the Results Grid

BIQ allows you to drill down into certain reports depending on the data in your result set. If one of the attributes that you selected is part of a hierarchy that has levels beneath it (sales regions and product categories are two common examples), you can drill down into the report results grid by point-and-click.

The type of cursor that appears when you hover the mouse over the grid indicates whether you can drill down or not. When the cursor shows the “click me” hand, you can drill into a report. At all other times, the regular cursor arrow icon will display when the mouse is hovering above the grid.

When you drill into a report, you are actually drilling into a specific row and thus BIQ highlights the row that you have selected. In the example shown here, the user is drilling into the row that corresponds to BREADS AND ROLLS. If you try to drill into a grid where there are more than one drill-friendly attribute, the drill menu will prompt you to choose which attribute you want to drill into. You can also drill into several at once by checking multiple boxes in the menu:

 

When you click the ‘Drill Down’ button, BIQ will automatically update the report filters based on the row that you selected and the attributes you chose to drill down into and then executes the new report. If the new report results can also be drilled down into, you can click on a row and drill down again using the same process. Once you have drilled down to the lowest possible level in all attributes, the Drill Menu will alert you that you cannot drill any further into the report.

Navigating the Drill Path
